name: NCSSM Online
description: A collection of virtual learning opportunities from NCSSM, including full courses and enrichment experiences like math circles and inquiry-based academic exploration offered during the school year.

name: NCSSM Connect
description: Real-time, instructor-led NCSSM courses delivered through partner high schools, often provided at no cost to enrolled students.

name: Chapel Hill Math Circle
description: A collaborative math enrichment program where students tackle advanced concepts and challenging problems in a group setting, typically meeting twice each month.

name: Durham Tech Dual Enrollment
description: College-level coursework options that allow qualified high school students to earn college credit while completing their high school education, with eligibility requirements depending on the pathway.

name: Wake Tech Dual Enrollment
description: A tuition-free program that enables eligible high school students to earn college credits or workforce credentials, often counting toward both high school graduation and future college goals.

name: Future Teachers of NC
description: The Future Teachers of North Carolina (FTNC) program is designed to inspire high school juniors and seniors to explore a career in teaching by offering an engaging and rigorous experience that introduces them to the training, responsibilities, and real-world aspects of becoming an educator.

name: The Engineering Place
description: The Engineering Place aims to motivate future problem solvers, innovators, and engineers by offering strong engineering education programs for K–12 students. By delivering interactive, hands-on learning opportunities for students and meaningful professional development for educators, the organization works to make engineering engaging and accessible to learners of all backgrounds.

name: Health and Environment Scholars @Duke
description: Duke University’s Nicholas School of the Environment and School of Medicine partner with Durham Public Schools to offer a year-long Health and Environmental Scholars Program for talented, underserved high school students. The program includes weekly in-person sessions with guest speakers, along with weekend field trips and hands-on lab experiences.

name: Raleigh Little Theatre - Teens on State/Teens Backstage
description: The Teens on Stage / Teens Backstage program strengthens students’ theatre skills by linking classes with hands-on production work and real-world themes. Open to students with varied experience levels, the program also builds communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills that extend beyond the arts.

name: NC YMCA Youth & Government
description: Youth and Government is a national civic program that helps high school students develop leadership skills by engaging directly with the policymaking process. Through local school or YMCA delegations, students gain hands-on experience in government and learn how to create positive change in their communities.

name: Raleigh Youth Council
description: The Raleigh Youth Council gives high school students a voice in local issues while building leadership skills through civic engagement, service, and special youth conferences.

name: Raleigh Teen Connect (RTC)
description: Raleigh Teen Connect (RTC) is a free program that connects teens to City of Raleigh resources, programs, facilities, and community services.

name: NC-MSEN Pre-College Program
description: The NC State NC-MSEN Pre-College Program is a STEM enrichment initiative for students in grades 6–12 that prepares participants for college pathways in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics through academic and enrichment experiences.
